column4: we import all >= serious bugs from Debian into our bugzilla so that we can track them, and sometimes we fix them ahead of Debian
(and send back the fix)
you can install ubuntu right now, no worries
hmm?
see the bugzilla of any distro :)
sorry, just confused by "you can install ubuntu right now, no worries"
perhaps you'll have a mandrake 10.1 report soon :)
the TV in question is > 20 years old, it's possible some part has just gone
the Ubuntu configuration is just what's in Debian experimental, really; I co-maintain openssh in Debian and am coordinating the two
this is good policy -- in debian and elsewhere, imo
heh. we agree i guess
not many; Indonesian's the one that springs to mind
hence why we'll be moving to it by default eventually
there are still Han unification problems in China/Japan languages, though

(basically, the Simplified-Chinese/Traditional-Chinese/Japanese characters with approximately similar meanings and etymology got glommed together into one Unicode glyph each, which apparently isn't always quite accurate)
hmm. i'm quite confident that technology (ie computers being american and not able to show sane characters) is the main reason why bad english is the official language of the internet :)
so it is! but not in hoary-updates. i wonder.
hoary-updates should be empty until hoary is released.
well, that explains it. i guess i should add warty-updates to sources.list :)
change it to "danielbo will fix it soon" :)
heh. already fixed in Debian though
just add Replaces: industrial to industrial-steel.deb
